title: Haryana IPS 'suicide': ADG’s wife accuses cops of diluting charges; DGP, SP 'not named in FIR'
content: Wife of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, Haryana IAS officer Amneet Kumar, has flagged discrepancies in the FIR registered following his suicide. She insists accused individuals, including senior police officials, are not clearly named and alleges dilution of SC/ST Act charges. Kumar also seeks copies of her husband's final note for verification.

title: 'Mamata must go': Political row erupts as another 'gang rape' evokes RG Kar horror
content: A medical student was allegedly gang-raped in West Bengal's Paschim Bardhaman district, sparking a political row. The BJP accused the state government of appeasement policies leading to a "nightmare for women's safety." West Bengal minister Shashi Panja urged the BJP not to politicize the crime and expressed faith in the ongoing investigation.

title: 'Fog won’t help terrorists': BSF's winter warning to Pak; India all set 'to foil infiltrations'
content: Border Security Force is ready for winter in the Jammu sector.  They will stop Pakistan-based terrorists from infiltrating.  Intelligence indicates terror groups are regrouping.  The BSF is on high alert.  They will respond to any attempts to push terrorists into India.  Modern warfare technology is being used.  The BSF is training its personnel to counter enemy drones.

title: 'AI layoffs are coming, yet jobs won’t vanish': JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon issued a stark warning about AI's disruptive potential, predicting job losses but also opportunities for worker redeployment. The bank is investing $2 billion annually in AI, already realizing significant cost savings and benefits. Dimon emphasized proactive adaptation, noting AI's integration across all bank functions and the importance of employee retraining.

title: Watch: Never seen before! WWE star Reigns turns Kohli inside ring
content: Roman Reigns shocked WWE fans at Crown Jewel 2025 by using a bat against Bronson Reed, reminiscent of a cricket match. This daring move followed Reigns's loss to Reed in an Australian Street Fight, where he was double-teamed and ultimately defeated by Reed's Tsunami. Reigns's return on Raw set up this rematch, but Reed once again secured a significant victory.

title: 'No matter how influential...' Haryana CM vows action in IPS 'suicide' case
content: Haryana CM assures strict action against anyone found guilty in IPS officer Y Puran Kumar's suicide probe, regardless of influence. The deceased officer's wife expressed dissatisfaction with the FIR, citing missing names and incomplete details, and requested corrections. She also alleged dilution of SC/ST Act charges and sought copies of crucial notes.

title: 'Indians' success in US no conspiracy': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu
content: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu explains why Indian professionals dominate American technology leadership, attributing it to unintended consequences of the H-1B visa and green card system. The lengthy immigration process made job switching risky, creating committed long-term employees who naturally earned promotions. Vembu emphasises R&D success requires time-intensive commitment, not just funding. His comments come amid controversy over Trump's proposed $100,000 H-1B fee.

title: Clashes rock Pakistan: Police fire on Gaza protesters - what we know so far
content: Hardline Islamist group Tehreek-i-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) protests turned violent across Pakistan, resulting in at least 11 deaths and dozens injured. Demonstrators marched towards Islamabad in solidarity with Palestinians, clashing with police who used tear gas and barricades. The TLP, known for disruptive protests, faced government warnings against further marches.

title: IND vs WI: Jaiswal put under pressure; asked to chase 'Sehwag ka 300 wala record'
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal continued his impressive Test form with a brilliant 175 against the West Indies in Delhi. His innings, a blend of patience and elegance, featured a significant partnership with B Sai Sudharsan. Jaiswal's consistent big hundreds are drawing comparisons to cricketing legends, with predictions of him breaking records.

title: 'PM not bigger than country': Owaisi's latest on Op Sindoor delegation— Watch
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi stated he joined the Operation Sindoor delegation for the country, not the Prime Minister, emphasizing national unity against terrorism. He highlighted India's stance against Pakistan-linked terror, sharing data on attacks. Separately, AIMIM plans to contest around 100 seats in Bihar's upcoming assembly elections, aiming to form a 'third alternative'.

title: Microsoft engineer quits after 13 years; sends resignation email to employees
content: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: Indian states men prefer to work in: Gujarat leads; check top 10 here
content: The India Skills Report 2025 reveals rising employability among men, reaching 53.46% in 2025. Male professionals prefer working in Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, and Haryana. These states offer career growth, infrastructure, and supportive ecosystems. Employers can use this insight for recruitment, while men can align career choices with high-opportunity regions.

title: 2nd Test: Gill’s 129 powers India; Jadeja spins Windies into trouble
content: India's spinners have taken control of the second Test against the West Indies. Captain Shubman Gill scored an impressive century, setting a strong foundation. The West Indies are trailing significantly after losing four wickets. Ravindra Jadeja claimed three wickets, putting India in a commanding position to win the series. The Indian team displayed excellent batting and bowling throughout the day.

title: NMC data shows India added just 21 doctors in a year when 80k graduated
content: India's doctor count appears stagnant, with the National Medical Commission (NMC) data showing minimal growth despite thousands graduating annually. Significant discrepancies exist between NMC figures and state medical council registrations, raising concerns about accurate healthcare planning and potentially misleading Parliament.

title: Barefoot & displaced, Palestinians return — What post-ceasefire Gaza looks like
content: Thousands of displaced Palestinians returned to Gaza's shattered north as a US-brokered ceasefire took effect, with Israeli troops beginning to withdraw. Families navigated rubble to reach ruined homes, marking a bittersweet return amid a new peace plan involving troop withdrawal and hostage swaps.

title: Eight Indians, 10 firms face US sanctions over Iran oil link
content: America has sanctioned eight Indian individuals and ten companies. These actions are due to their involvement in trading Iranian oil. The US state department and treasury targeted numerous entities globally. Several Indian firms are accused of importing Iranian-origin petrochemicals and LPG. These shipments were destined for China and Pakistan. The sanctions highlight ongoing efforts to curb Iran's oil trade.

title: Amitabh Bachchan's secrets to staying healthy at 83: Sleep, cleandiet&more
content: Amitabh Bachchan, at 83, continues to inspire with his disciplined lifestyle. His routine emphasizes daily movement, including pranayama and stretches, alongside a clean, plant-based diet rich in Ayurvedic ingredients. Prioritizing eight to nine hours of sleep and maintaining an unwavering mindset are key to his robust health and longevity, offering valuable lessons for all.

title: Gautam Gambhir's straight talk: 'I'll take all criticism for Shubman Gill'
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir has pledged unwavering support for new ODI captain Shubman Gill, stating he's prepared to absorb all criticism to shield the young leader. Gambhir emphasized Gill's transparency and dedication, noting his "brilliant" start in leadership roles. The coach's commitment aims to foster Gill's growth and ensure team success.

title: Tejashwi new Rahul? Prashant Kishor says RJD leader could meet Amethi fate in Raghopur
content: Jan Suraj founder Prashant Kishor has challenged RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, stating he would contest from Raghopur, a seat currently held by Yadav. Kishor predicted Yadav would lose the constituency, drawing a parallel to Rahul Gandhi's Amethi defeat. He alleged Raghopur lacks basic amenities despite being represented by Yadav and his parents.

title: 'Adult content': Akhilesh questions FB account suspension; claims post on journo, woman's death
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's Facebook account, with over 8.5 million followers, was temporarily suspended, sparking accusations of silencing opposition voices. Yadav stated the suspension was due to posts about a journalist's murder and a woman's suspicious death, questioning pressure on media under the BJP. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw denied government involvement, citing Facebook's policy on abusive content.

title: Police brutality in MP: How party in 'parking lot' ended in tragedy for BTech student
content: A 21-year-old man, Udit Gayaki, died after allegedly being beaten by two on-duty constables while celebrating his graduation. The incident occurred after police reportedly demanded a bribe, leading to an assault.  An autopsy cited pancreatic hemorrhage as the cause of death, and the constables have been suspended.

title: LeBron, Savannah James praise A’ja Wilson after dominant 2025 WNBA Finals
content: A'ja Wilson dominated the 2025 WNBA Finals, leading the Las Vegas Aces to victory and securing her fourth consecutive MVP award. LeBron James and his wife Savannah celebrated her achievement on Instagram, expressing their admiration. Wilson previously embraced comparisons to LeBron James, highlighting her passion, fun, and unique journey in the league.

title: Ground Boeing 787s, demands pilots’ body
content: An Air India Boeing 787 diverted to Dubai due to a technical snag, with its autopilot system failing. This follows another incident last week where a Dreamliner's ram air turbine deployed on approach. The Federation of Indian Pilots has urged the grounding of all B787s amid continuous electrical issues and called for a special audit of Air India's aircraft maintenance.

title: 'Discussed India-US ties': Jaishankar meets ambassador-designate Sergio Gor
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met US Ambassador-designate Sergio Gor in New Delhi to discuss the growing strategic partnership between India and the United States. Gor's visit aims to familiarize himself with India following his Senate confirmation, with formal credential presentation to follow later.

title: Visa chaos in Serbia: India’s Chessboxing hopes end; 'We just wanted to play'
content: 11 Indian chessboxing athletes were forced to miss the World Championships in Serbia after their visas weren’t processed in time, despite applying weeks in advance. The contingent waited outside the Serbian embassy in vain as bureaucratic delays crushed months of preparation. The incident echoes past visa troubles that have cost Indian athletes key opportunities at global events.

title: Israel-Hamas ceasefire deal: US troops arrive in Tel Aviv to oversee truce
content: US troops are deploying to Israel to help manage a Gaza ceasefire, with a 200-member team set to establish a joint control center and coordinate aid. Meanwhile, thousands of displaced Palestinians are returning to devastated areas, facing lingering dangers and uncertainty about lasting peace following the conflict's initial phase.

title: US hits China with 100% tariffs! Will it benefit India? Here’s what experts say
content: Indian exporters are poised to benefit from increased US tariffs on Chinese goods, potentially shifting demand towards India. Experts believe this escalation, with the US imposing a 100% additional tariff on Chinese imports, will create a level playing field and open significant export opportunities for India in the American market.

title: 'Shocking': Sonia writes to Haryana IPS widow; flags bias against social justice
content: Senior IPS officer Y. Puran Kumar died by suicide, naming 16 IAS and IPS officers in his note for alleged harassment. Sonia Gandhi expressed solidarity with his wife, highlighting the incident as a "grim reminder" of power's biased attitude. The Haryana government has initiated reshuffles in police leadership amid growing pressure.

title: Trump’s 100% tariffs on China: GTRI cautions India, says no deal with US is ever final
content: A GTRI report advises India to negotiate cautiously with the US and prioritize self-reliance over dependence on Washington. The think tank analyzed the impact of US tariffs on China, suggesting India should safeguard its strategic autonomy and strengthen ties with both Western and BRICS nations to mitigate trade shocks.

title: 'Cheapskate tourist': Couple skips hotel stay in Singapore; spends night at Changi Airport instead
content: A couple opted for a budget-friendly sleepover at Singapore's Changi Airport, forgoing expensive hotels during the Formula 1 Grand Prix. Their viral TikTok video documented their experience finding a spot in the airport's 'Sleeper Village,' managing a few hours of rest. While many praised their resourcefulness, some voiced concerns about the impact on the airport's reputation.

title: IND vs WI: ‘I can never forget that’: Gambhir opens up on his toughest coaching moment
content: India's head coach Gautam Gambhir revealed that the disappointing home series loss to New Zealand remains a defining low point, influencing his coaching philosophy. He emphasizes the importance of away-from-home success for a world-class team, using the painful memory to instill a never-take-anything-for-granted mindset in his players.

title: 'No name given': After Harjinder Singh, ICE arrests another Indian - What we know so far
content: ICE apprehended an Indian national with a New York commercial driver's license, identified only as 'Anmol,' who allegedly entered the US illegally. Officials claim New York issued the license without proper name verification, posing a public safety risk. However, New York DMV disputes the illegal status, stating the individual has federal work authorization and lawful status.

title: Perverts in public places: Journalist's disturbing encounter exposes Delhi's everyday misogyny
content: A Delhi journalist's daily commute turned terrifying after a man exposed himself and made a lewd gesture. This unsettling incident highlights the pervasive fragility of women's safety in public spaces across Delhi-NCR, where such acts of perversion, often driven by a need for control and dominance, are alarmingly common and deeply impact personal security.

title: Historic feat! After 64 years, Team India smashes batting record vs West Indies
content: Team India achieved a historic feat, recording 50+ partnerships for all first five wickets in a Test innings for the first time in 64 years. This remarkable performance, featuring centuries from Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill, secured a dominant position against West Indies.

title: Shedeur Sanders’ mom Pilar shows support to ex Deion amid health struggles
content: Colorado football coach Deion Sanders faced another health scare undergoing surgery for blood clots. He returned to practice swiftly. His ex-wife Pilar Sanders showed her support by wearing a Colorado sweatshirt. This highlights family unity despite past complexities. Sanders continues coaching while managing his health with loved ones cheering him on.

title: 'Women have equal rights in our country': Rahul slams PM Modi over Taliban presser
content: Opposition leaders have strongly criticized the Taliban's exclusion of women journalists from a press conference in New Delhi, calling it an attack on women's rights and democracy. Leaders like Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi questioned Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led government on the issue, highlighting India's commitment to gender equality and democratic rights.

title: IPS 'suicide' case: Haryana removes Narendra Bijraniya from SP post
content: Following the suicide of senior IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, the Haryana government has replaced Rohtak SP Narendra Bijraniya with Surinder Singh Bhoria. This reshuffle comes amid pressure after Kumar's suicide note named eight senior IPS officers, including DGP Shatrujeet Singh Kapur, alleging harassment. Kumar's wife has demanded their suspension and arrest.

title: Centre to introduce AI in school curriculum from Class 3 in 2026-27
content: From the 2026-27 academic year, India will introduce AI education for students from Class 3 onwards, aligning with NEP 2020. CBSE is developing frameworks and training over one crore teachers. Pilot projects and AI modules are expanding rapidly. The move aims to equip students with essential AI literacy, prepare the workforce for future tech-driven jobs, and position India as a global AI hub.

title: On Diwali, ‘green crackers’ set to return with a bang
content: The Supreme Court is poised to permit the sale and use of green firecrackers in Delhi and NCR for Diwali, Gurupurav, and Christmas. While reserving orders, the bench questioned the necessity of a complete ban, noting no significant increase in pollution attributed to crackers. The government proposed strict measures, including a ban on series crackers and online sales, to ensure only approved green crackers are available.

title: Nobel Peace winner Maria Machado: A democracy activist forced to live in hiding
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado has been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for her unwavering commitment to democratic rights and her fight for a democratic transition in Venezuela.  Despite facing a ban from public office, Machado's primary victory highlighted widespread support for her vision of liberal economic reforms and a collective struggle for change.

title: Indian IT hit by ‘silent layoffs’! 50,000 people may lose jobs
content: India's tech sector is experiencing silent layoffs, with projections of over 50,000 workers impacted by year-end. Companies are reducing surplus staff through performance-linked departures and delayed career advancements, driven by AI adoption and business prudence. This trend signals a shift towards skills management and flatter structures in the industry.

title: ‘Hate messages coming from Pak’: Wankhede says defamation against Netflix series is personal
content: Former NCB officer Sameer Wankhede has filed a defamation suit against Netflix and Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment over the series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. He claims the show maligns his reputation and insults anti-drug agencies, stating the legal action is personal and for self-respect. Wankhede seeks damages and an injunction against the series' distribution.

title: 'Until you prove it, they don’t ... ': Samson breaks silence after ODI snub - Watch
content: Rajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson identified his maiden international century against South Africa as a career-defining moment. This performance solidified his self-belief, convincing him he belonged at the highest level. Following this century, Samson experienced a career resurgence, excelling in the IPL and earning a T20 World Cup call-up.

title: Chennai ragpicker tied to pole, beaten to death for alleged theft; body dumped in canal
content: A 26-year-old ragpicker met a brutal end near Red Hills, allegedly beaten to death by workers at a plastic chair manufacturing unit. Caught stealing scrap, he was tied to a pole and assaulted with rods before his body was found in a canal. Relatives protested, demanding justice. Police have registered a murder case against the owner and a worker.

title: M's punch ALCS ticket in 15-inning instant classic
content: In a thriller that lasted nearly five hours, Jorge Polanco's walk-off single in the 15th put the Mariners in the ALCS with a 3-2 Game 5 win over the Tigers.

title: Aces sweep, solidify dynasty with 3rd title in 4 years
content: The Aces, led by MVP A'ja Wilson, beat the Mercury 97-86 to complete a four-game Finals sweep and win their third WNBA championship in four seasons.

title: Tibbetts: Ejection in closeout G4 'weak,' unmerited
content: Mercury coach Nate Tibbetts was critical of his ejection late in Game 4 of the WNBA Finals, calling it "one of the weakest double technicals ever."

title: Source: Pujols, Angels discuss managerial opening
content: Albert Pujols met with Angels general manager Perry Minasian about the team's managerial vacancy but hasn't been offered the job, a source told ESPN.

title: Sources: Big Ten closes in on $2 billion capital deal
content: The Big Ten is approaching a vote on a capital agreement and the formation of Big Ten Enterprises, which would infuse league schools with more than $2 billion, according to sources.

title: Gauff, Pegula to square off in first final matchup
content: Coco Gauff had more struggles with her serve but overcame seven double faults to beat Jasmine Paolini, while Jessica Pegula ended Aryna Sabalenka's multiyear winning streak at the Wuhan Open.

title: Knicks, Raptors agree to voluntarily dismiss lawsuit
content: The Knicks and Raptors agreed to voluntarily dismiss a 2023 lawsuit involving the alleged theft of thousands of confidential files, according to a court filing Friday that was obtained by ESPN.

title: Poch: 'Brave' U.S. upped tempo in Ecuador draw
content: United States coach Mauricio Pochettino praised the spirit of his players, who earned a comeback 1-1 draw against Ecuador in an aggressive friendly Friday that included a 71st-minute equalizer from Folarin Balogun.

title: 🍼 Bo Nix and wife Izzy announce pregnancy
content: The Denver Broncos quarterback announced the news in a shared Instagram post with his wife, Izzy Nix.

title: 31 games that could bring a sense of order to college football's season of chaos
content: New attractions -- Indiana-Oregon and Alabama-Missouri -- mix with old standbys such as Oklahoma-Texas this weekend.

title: The three stars who made the Aces three-time WNBA champs
content: Las Vegas won on the shoulders of A'ja Wilson, Chelsea Gray and Jackie Young. The trio has no plans to stop.

title: 'You run out of adjectives': Another year, another title for A'ja Wilson
content: Wilson has been called a lot of things this postseason: an elk, a shark, a lion. But is it time to call her the GOAT?

title: The ALCS is set! Odds, X factors and how the Mariners and Blue Jays can reach the World Series
content: It's the AL's top two seeds for a trip to the Fall Classic. Here's your first look at how Seattle and Toronto stack up.

title: NFL predictions, fantasy sleepers, trends for Week 6: Keep an eye on Sam Darnold?
content: Could Darnold be a fantasy sleeper? Can the Chiefs' defense stop the Lions' play-action? Here's last-minute intel for Week 6.

title: USMNT's second half vs. Ecuador gives positives for Pochettino
content: The U.S is at last playing with the kind of energy and desire that manager Mauricio Pochettino demands.

title: Four ways LeBron James' unprecedented 23rd NBA season could go
content: Retirement? Re-up with the Lakers? Request a trade? Here are the various pathways for LeBron and the Lakers for the 2025-26 campaign.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Gamrot end Oliveira's unbeaten streak in Brazil?
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the UFC Fight Night Rio main event, and Ian Parker gives value picks for the card.

title: College football best bets for Week 7: Why an 0-5 team should be on your bet slip
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 7 of the college football season, including what makes UMass-Kent State a solid game to bet.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Packers, Broncos among top options in Week 6
content: Predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 6, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Don't be surprised if... McMillan finds end zone, Judkins finishes top 3 in rushing
content: Week 6 storylines include a pair of impressive rookies, and is the Mayfield/Egbuka connection sustainable?

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 6
content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks, plus projected scores for every game.

title: 'Basically playing for pizza': Remembering Sean Payton's six-month run as the QB of the Leicester Panthers
content: Before he became a Super Bowl-winning coach, Payton played quarterback on an English team alongside bouncers and construction workers.

title: Pain, rehab and unlikely inspiration: Inside Aidan Hutchinson's return to dominance
content: Hutchinson's long journey back from a broken leg found inspiration from children whom he has inspired, too.

title: How Oregon's Dante Moore, Indiana's Fernando Mendoza became unlikely NFL darlings
content: An under-the-radar three-star and a seemingly forgotten five-star, Mendoza and Moore are rising up draft boards.

title: Reid's debut NFL draft QB Hot Board for 2026
content: Who are the best quarterbacks in class? We ranked the top 14, including some playing each other this week.

title: ↔️ QB-needy Bengals land Flacco in Browns trade
content: The Bengals turned to their division rivals for a much-needed solution at quarterback, acquiring Joe Flacco in a trade with the Browns.

title: 🏀 Collier, Engelbert and WNBA teetering on brink
content: Amid the WNBA Finals, two of the most powerful people in the game are locked in a contentious battle -- for public opinion, power and money.

title: 💰 Former player donates $50M to Stanford football
content: The Stanford football program received a $50 million gift from a former player, the school announced Wednesday, marking a significant donation as it attempts to revive the fortunes of the program under general manager Andrew Luck.

title: 🔥 How Roki Sasaki became Dodgers' 100 mph reliever
content: After a disastrous MLB debut, L.A.'s new ninth-inning man has unleashed jaw-dropping stuff in October. Here's what fueled the sudden turnaround.

title: 🏀 Giannis has finally put the Bucks on the clock
content: In a transformative summer for the Bucks, the team had discussions about moving the two-time MVP to New York.

title: 🍻 LeBron raises glass in latest 'decision'
content: LeBron James teased a second "decision," which turned out to be an ad for Hennessy, the cognac brand with which James has been a longtime partner. The announcement prompted a boost in ticket prices for the Lakers' last regular-season game.

title: What's wrong with Liverpool: Transfers? Salah? Fixtures?
content: Liverpool have lost three games in a row in all competitions, having spent £450m over the summer, but what are some of the factors behind their slump?

title: How to fix Man United in four steps (with some help from Liverpool, Arsenal and Man City)
content: Man United haven't had sustained Premier League success in more than a decade. Here's what they need to do.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Inter Miami eye Messi, Suárez, Neymar reunion
content: Inter Miami could reunite former Barcelona pair Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez with Neymar in a blockbuster move. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Impending free agents, aging stars and an injured ace: How much longer can the Phillies keep contending?
content: This October brought another early exit for a Philly squad with World Series aspirations. Where does the team go from here?

title: NHL breakout tiers: From Nazar to Snuggerud to Peterka, players set to level up
content: From players with new linemates to young stars set to hit superstardom to enticing rookies, watch out for this group.

title: Why did CFB move its transfer portal? What do coaches think? Is tampering a problem?
content: The NCAA officially moved its football transfer portal to January, but not without questions. We have answers.

title: Wetzel: Why college basketball coaches can watch more football in 2025
content: The NCAA's stalled 5-in-5 rule has put a hold on much of college basketball recruiting until next spring.

title: Karnataka association to shortly release rules for conduct of Kambala races
content: Among the rules include a bar for ‘Kambala’ jockeys or other personnel from hitting buffaloes when they enter the plain land after crossing the slush track

title: Not a single tree will be felled: DKS assures Lalbagh safety amid civic uproar
content: Deputy Chief Minister has dismissed reports that six acres of land would be acquired for tunnel project as ‘false’

title: CM enquires about food poisoning at BC hostel in Guntur district
content: Chandrababu Naidu seeks detailed information about the hostel facilities, food quality, and drinking water supply

title: New governing body of Kanaka Durga temple assumes charge
content: Temple chairman Borra Radhakrishna (Gandhi) and 16 members have darshan of Goddess Sri Kanaka Durga Devi and take ‘teertha prasadams’ on the occasion

title: Calicut varsity campus shut down after clash between students
content: This follows a clash between SFI and UDSF activists during the election to the students’ union representing various departments on the campus

title: Home for homeless children in Shivamogga offers care with a mother’s touch
content: More than 430 boys have benefited from ‘Thayi Mane’ in Shivamogga in the last 16 years. A student is studying MBBS, while four have completed BE, and many have learnt skills which has secured them jobs

title: BJP MLAs assured of formation of popular government in Manipur soon
content: The Centre had imposed the President’s rule in Manipur after Chief Minister N. Biren Singh resigned, amid ethnic violence between Meiteis and Kuki-Zo groups

title: R&B Minister reviews arrangements for PM’s Kurnool visit
content: Highlights the need for strong security, uninterrupted traffic flow, adequate transport facilities, and proper drinking water arrangements for the public gathering

title: West Bengal Congress constitutes committee to ‘safeguard of voting rights, citizenship’
content: Constituted amidst reports of an impending Special Intensive Revision of the State’s electoral rolls, the committee will coordinate the party’s activities surrounding the SIR as well as citizenship matters such as the National Register of Citizens and the Citizenship Amendment Act

title: Nodal officers told to conduct regular inspections of all Anna Canteens
content: Guntur Municipal Commissioner inspects the Anna Canteen near Mirchi Yard and interacts with beneficiaries before issuing specific instructions to the staff

title: Haryana IPS officer death: Family will get justice, says CM Saini
content: Haryana CM Saini said he has spoken to late IPS officer Puran Kumar’s wife and added the State government is “in touch with the Centre for the resolution of this issue”

title: Victim Killed Over Bidi: Cops Crack Raipur 'Blind Murder' Mystery, Arrest 3
content: A 'blind murder' mystery in Raipur's Amner village has been solved by the police. Three men were arrested for killing 26-year-old Sonu Pal on Thursday, whose body was found floating in a drain near Goda Pul earlier this week.

title: "Breeding Ground Of Horror": Spanish Cops Find 250 Dead Animals In Filthy Warehouse
content: Spanish police on Saturday said they made an arrest after finding 250 dead animals, mostly dogs, in a filthy warehouse that local media dubbed "the breeding ground of horror".

title: NDTV Raises Rs 396.49 Crore Via Rights Issue To Fuel Growth
content: NDTV has raised Rs 396.49 crore through a rights issue to fund expansion, digital initiatives, and debt reduction.

title: 'For Taliban, Women Not Human': Taslima Nasreen On Row Over Journalist 'Ban'
content: Bangladesh's exiled writer Taslima Nasreen has slammed Afghan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi for not allowing women journalists to attend a press conference in Delhi on Friday.

title: Video: Tornado Hits Odisha's Famous Chilika Lake, Sparks Awe, Then Panic
content: A tornado hit the famous Chilika Lake in Odisha on Friday, sparking reactions of panic and awe from tourists visiting the site. The tornado was seen southwest of the temple of Kalijai while hundreds of tourists were enjoying the view.

title: Taliban Foreign Minister Visits UP's Deoband, Hopes For "Stronger" Ties With India
content: Afghan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi on Saturday voiced confidence that the India-Afghanistan ties will grow stronger in the future as he thanked the people for the welcome he received during his visit to Darul Uloom Deoband in Saharanpur

title: Student Made To Sit On Floor Over Unpaid Fees. Case Filed Against Headmistress
content: Police have registered a case against the headmistress and a teacher of an Urdu medium school in Bhiwandi for allegedly forcing a 14-year-old student to write his unit test sitting on the classroom floor due to unpaid fees, an official said

title: 5 Constituencies At Centre Of RJD, Congress's Bihar Seat Struggle: Sources
content: Seat-sharing talks in the Indian National Developmental Inclusive Alliance (INDIA) for next month's Bihar assembly elections appear to be facing some headwinds as the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) and the Congress are jostling over five seats.

title: UK Says Air Force Jets Joined US, NATO In 12-Hour Patrol Near Russia Border
content: Britain said on Saturday that two Royal Air Force aircraft flew a 12-hour mission earlier this week alongside U.S. and NATO forces to patrol the border of Russia, amid a series of recent Russian drone and aircraft incursions into NATO airspace.

title: Cops Receive Key Report On Zubeen Garg's Death Amid Poisoning Angle Probe
content: The Assam Police's Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the death of iconic singer Zubeen Garg has received the viscera report from the Central Forensic Science Laboratory (CFSL) in New Delhi, a senior officer said on Saturday.

title: "Can Do Politics Without You": DK Shivakumar Loses Cool Over Media Report
content: Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has asserted he's "not in a hurry" for a promotion amid a renewed buzz of leadership change in Karnataka.

title: Out With Friend, Medical Student Gang-Raped Near Private College In Bengal
content: A second-year MBBS student from Odisha was gang-raped near a private medical college in West Bengal's Durgapur on Friday night.

title: Why UP's Deoband Was On Taliban Foreign Minister's India Itinerary
content: Amir Khan Muttaqi, Foreign Minister of the Taliban-led government in Afghanistan, is in India for a seven-day visit. As part of his itinerary, Muttaqi will visit the historic Darul Uloom Deoband in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday.

title: After Haryana Cop's Suicide, A Letter From Sonia Gandhi To His Wife
content: The alleged suicide by a senior Haryana Police official, Y Puran Kumar, continued to remain in political focus on Saturday, with Congress leader Sonia Gandhi offering condolences to the family and criticising the "biased attitude of those in power"

title: Haryana Cop Named In Suicide Note Of IPS Officer Y Puran Kumar Transferred
content: The Haryana government on Saturday transferred Rohtak Superintendent of Police Narendra Bijarniya, days after IPS officer Y Puran Kumar allegedly shot himself dead at his Chandigarh residence, officials said.

title: Trinamool To Hold 100 'Bijoya Sammelani' Meetings, Electoral Rolls In Focus
content: The Trinamool Congress is set to hold 100 'Bijoya Sammelani' meetings on Sunday - with the focus on Special Intensive Revision (SIR) and public outreach before the 2026 elections.

title: Fall Of Bira 91: How A Name Change Led To Beer Brand's Dramatic Collapse
content: A minor legal name change from B9 Beverages Private Limited to B9 Beverages Limited has triggered regulatory hurdles, halted sales and intensified employee unrest at Bira 91.

title: Delhi Cops Reunite Intellectually-Challenged Woman With Family After 37 Days
content: Delhi Police has reunited a 21-year-old intellectually-challenged woman from Madhya Pradesh, who was found abandoned in a pregnant state in Shahdara last month, with her family after a 37-day search, officials said on Saturday.

title: S Jaishankar Meets US Ambassador-Designate Sergio Gor Amid Trade Tensions
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday held talks with US ambassador-designate Sergio Gor amid continuing strains in the relations over Washington's imposition of 50 per cent tariffs on Indian exports.

title: Election Body Seeks Video Of Mamata Banerjee Warning State Poll Chief: Sources
content: The Election Commission of India has sought the video of Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee making threatening remarks against West Bengal's Chief Electoral Officer (CEO), said sources, months before the eastern state votes to elect a new government.

title: 75 stadiums, 45 states, one vision: Why the Savannah Bananas' next step is their biggest yet
content: The Savannah Bananas prepare for a new era of bodacious baseball. Check out what "Banana Ball" is doing next.

title: 'You're just poking the bear': Bucs' Wirfs recalls fan heckling Baker in Seattle
content: Buccaneers left tackle Wirfs witnessed Mayfield's trash-talking exchange with a Seahawks fan last Sunday.

title: Reese to become first professional athlete to walk in Victoria's Secret Fashion Show
content: The Chicago Sky star will make history as the first professional athlete to walk in the fashion show.

title: Cheat sheet: 2025-26 NBA player rankings, schedule grid, more
content: Here is all of our key fantasy basketball draft content -- rankings, sleepers, schedule grid and draft tips -- collected into downloadable/printable PDF cheat sheets.

title: I was denied the job of part-time law lecturer, says former Attorney General Parasaran
content: The 98-year-old doyen of the Bar sweeps Supreme Court and Madras High Court judges off their feet with his wit and humour

title: Appraisal of valuables begins at Sabarimala temple
content: After completing procedures at Sabarimala, retired judge K.T. Sankaran will inspect TDB’s main strongroom at Aranmula

title: India could withstand external shocks due to strong domestic demand and economic policies: Shaktikanta Das
content: Shaktikanta Das emphasised that India’s underlying priority in free trade agreement negotiations with the U.S. and other countries is to secure fair and balanced agreements in the best interest of the Indian people

title: Odisha CM condemns West Bengal ‘gang-rape’ incident involving medical student from State, urges action
content: CM Majhi also instructed senior officials to contact the West Bengal government and take necessary steps

title: BMTC bus driver suffers seizure, hits several vehicles in Bengaluru
content: BMTC officials confirmed that the accident was caused by the driver’s sudden health condition and assured that all affected vehicle owners are safe

title: Assam SIT receives Zubeen Garg’s viscera report
content: A senior police officer said Singapore was examining India’s request for a probe into the death of the Assamese cultural icon in the island country

title: Hassan DC suspends two officials for misusing their IDs
content: Hassan district administration has involved officials from different departments for making arrangements at Hasanamba Temple during the festival, that began on October 9

title: Cough syrup deaths: Congress seeks CBI probe, MP Health Minister's resignation over government 'negligence'
content: Madhya Pradesh Congress chief Jitu Patwari demanded that a case be registered against the drug controller, and the Principal Secretary of the state health department be removed from the post

title: Cheluvarayaswamy inspects rain-affected regions in Mandya, assures early release of compensation to farmers
content: Mandya received heavy to very heavy rains in the last two days and inundated low-lying areas, breached an irrigation canal that led to inundation of agricultural fields

title: CAG flags errors and inaccuracies in SPARK data of Kerala government, underscores need for ‘validation checks’
content: As per the report, in more than 12,000 current records of government employees, the year of their birth or the year of joining the service was given as 1900

title: Committed to improve quality of education and ensure accessibility to all in Karnataka: School Education Minister Madhu Bangarappa
content: Stating that he had been making efforts to improve the quality of education, the Minister said that the government would be setting up 800 new Karnataka Public Schools (KPS)

title: PM Modi virtually inaugurates ₹76.5 crore milk powder plant in Indore
content: The plant, set up under the Indore Cooperative Milk Union, has the capacity to produce 30 metric tonnes of milk powder per day, says officials

title: Notice pasted at Tauqeer Raza’s Bareilly home to recover loan he took three decades back
content: Tauqeer Raza, involved in Bareilly violence, faces property seizure for defaulting on a ₹5,055 loan now at ₹28,346

title: Opposition criticises PM Modi over exclusion of women journalists from Afghan Foreign Minister’s press meet
content: Congress and Left leaders seek clarification from the Prime Minister; question government’s silence after event restricted to male reporters

title: Bihar elections: JD(U) re-inducts ex-MP Arun Kumar who once threatened to break Nitish's ribs
content: Arun Kumar's re-induction is being seen as an attempt to neutralise the damage that may have been caused by another upper caste Bhumihar leader from Jehanabad, Rahul Sharma, jumping ship

title: Mahayuti government committed to fulfilling Bal Thackeray's dream of housing for every Mumbaikar: Shinde
content: According to Eknath Shinde, the MHADA has already built over nine lakh houses across the State and added that 35 to 40 citizens compete for each flat, which shows their trust in the authority

title: Prime Ministers Museum and Library’s oral history project: a repository of interviews on historical milestones of India
content: The Oral History Division has in fact emerged as one of the top destinations for researchers, historians and students working on history of modern India; interview transcripts are made available to scholars and researchers for consultation in the Reading Room of the Manuscripts Section of the PMML

title: T-Square Project construction from November: CM Revanth Reddy tells officials
content: Telangana Chief Minister reviews progress of AI Hub and T-Square project, aiming to make Hyderabad a global tech hub

title: 'Paper leak': Uttarakhand cancels graduate-level recruitment examination; to be held within three months
content: During the September 21 examination, three pages of the question paper were allegedly leaked from a centre in Haridwar, causing a stir across the State

title: PM lays foundation stones for ₹160-crore fishery projects in Odisha
content: The fishery projects included a ₹100-crore integrated aqua park at Basantapur in Sambalpur district and a Rs 59.13-crore fish market at Pandara in Bhubaneswar

title: Afghan Foreign Minister visits Darul Uloom Deoband Islamic seminary, says hopeful of stronger ties with India
content: Amir Khan Muttaqi, who reached Deoband from Delhi by road with his delegation, was welcomed by Mohtamim (vice-chancellor) of Darul Uloom Deoband Abul Qasim Nomani, president of Jamiat Ulama-e-Hind Maulana Arshad Madani and officials of Darul Uloom, amid a floral shower

title: e-waste collection drive nets 97,678 kg across 93 urban local bodies in Kerala
content: 92,743 kg e-waste and 4,935 kg was hazardous e-waste collected. Ernakulam tops in e-waste collection and Kannur in hazardous e-waste collection

title: Bihar polls: BJP, NDA allies hold meeting; seat sharing formula to be declared on October 12
content: According to NDA sources, the JD(U) is likely to contest around 101 or 102 seats and the BJP on one seat less than the JD(U)

title: Will issue show cause notice: Ajit Pawar on NCP MLA’s ‘Diwali shopping from Hindus’ remarks
content: The NCP chief was responding to media reports accusing MLA Sangram Jagtap of appealing to people to buy exclusively from Hindu shopkeepers and traders

title: CJI Gavai flags vulnerability of girl children in digital era, calls for specialised training
content: To secure her safety is not merely to protect her body, but to free her spirit, says CJI Gavai at a meeting on safegaurding girl children.

title: Delhi CM distributes ex gratia of ₹1 crore to families of 11 Corona Warriors
content: The frontline workers service and dedication saved thousands of lives. The Delhi government stands with the families of those Karmyogis who sacrificed their lives on duty, discharging their responsibilities, says Delhi CM

title: Haryana IPS officer's death: Congress leaders meet deceased's family in Chandigarh
content: Y. Puran Kumar’s family members claimed on Saturday (October 11) that the body was shifted to the PGIMER without consulting them

title: Singer Kumar Sanu moves Delhi HC to protect personality and publicity rights
content: Playback singer seeks injunction against unauthorised use of his name, voice and likeness, including AI-generated content

title: Lack of road connectivity forces Kuttaiyur villagers depend on Karnataka
content: Villagers say the issue can be resolved only if a bridge is built and bus services are extended from the nearest habitation to their village.

title: Orange alert for three districts in Kerala
content: Orange alert for Idukki, Kannur and Kasaragod and yellow alert for Pathanamthitta, Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode and Wayanad on October 11

title: TVK party flags in EPS campaign shows the AIADMK is desperate for an alliance with Vijay: TTV Dinakaran
content: The desperation of the AIADMK leader only indicates that his party is getting weaker day by day, Mr. Dhinakaran said

title: India, Canada looking at framework for strategic cooperation during Anand's Delhi visit
content: The Canadian Foreign Minister’s trip to India comes over three weeks after Canada’s National Security Advisor Nathalie Drouin visited India and held extensive talks with his Indian counterpart Ajit Doval

title: BC quota | Telangana Government mulling to move Supreme Court against High Court’s objection
content: Chief Minister Revanth Reddy said the government was committed to 42% reservation for BCs in local self-government institutions

title: Former Kerala High Court judge K.T. Sankaran begins appraisal of valuables at Sabarimala temple
content: After completing the procedures at Sabarimala, the former judge will inspect  Travancore Devaswom Board’s main strongroom at Aranmula

title: Man arrested from Alwar for allegedly spying for Pakistan
content: The accused, Mangat Singh, was produced before a special court in Jaipur on Saturday and remanded in police custody for three days, officials said. He was arrested on Friday

title: PM Modi meets Qualcomm CEO; discusses AI and innovation
content: Qualcomm President and CEO Cristiano R Amon met the Prime Minister at his official residence on Friday (October 10)

title: Nirbhaya Fund helped set up 854 one-stop centres for women across India: WCD Minister
content: Women and Child Development Minister Annapurna Devi discusses initiatives to empower women and protect children in India in a two-day consultation meet

title: 10 children among 12 rescued from bonded labour in Beed
content: Migrant labourers from Palghar near Mumbai were found to be working in ‘inhuman conditions’ for several years, with advances of ₹5,000-10,000 paid to them at the time they joined work, officials said.

title: INTACH, Vijayawada to organise heritage car rally on Sunday
content: Registration and scrutiny will start at 7 a.m. at Siddhartha College and the car rally will be flagged off at 8.30 a.m.

title: Maharashtra government suspends farm loan recovery in rain-affected tehsils
content: Earlier this week, the State Government announced a compensation package of ₹31,628 crore for farmers who suffered massive losses due to rains and floods

title: Akhilesh Yadav's Facebook account restored; Vaishnaw says no role in 'suspension'
content: There was an abusive post from his account, and Facebook blocked it as per its policies, says Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Biased attitude of those in power deprives even senior officials of social justice: Sonia Gandhi on Haryana IPS officer death
content: “I, and millions of people of the country, stand with you on this path to justice,” Sonia Gandhi wrote to the wife of the late IPS officer

title: Medical student from Odisha gang-raped in West Bengal
content: The mother alleged that her daughter was “gang-raped” around 10 p.m. on October 10 when she went out of the college campus with one of her friends for dinner

title: Jaishankar meets U.S. ambassador-designate Sergio Gor
content: Mr. Gor, accompanied by Deputy Secretary for Management and Resources Michael J. Rigas, is on a six-day visit to New Delhi

title: Odisha cabinet approves six river linking projects at ₹1790 crore
content: These projects are expected to improve drought resilience, create additional water storage, mitigate flood risks, and boost agricultural productivity, says the government

title: India-China flights: IndiGo starts Delhi-Guangzhou route from Nov 10; Kolkata-Guangzhou from Oct 26

title: All you need to know for every game in Week 6 -- including final score predictions
content: the Bucs host the 49ers for a showdown between 4-1 teams . the Lions visit the Chiefs' Arrowhead Stadium for the second time in three seasons . we have you covered with everything you need to know .

title: How Brewers and Cubs can each win decisive Game 5, plus lineups and analysis
content: the national league division series between the Chicago Cubs and the Milwaukee Brewers comes down to one last meeting tonight at American Family Field . the winner moves on to face the los Angeles Dodgers for the NL pennant .

title: The greatest Yankee never to win a title? Another Aaron Judge year wasted -- so what's next?
content: new: "you play to win. And when you don't win, it's not a good year," he says . new: a dejected judge has had to reflect on a season without a world Series title . "it's what you play for," judge says after the Yankees' game 4 loss to the Toronto Blue Jays .

title: Crown Jewel live results and analysis: WWE takes over Australia
content: the crown jewel event at RAC Center in Perth features two crown jewel championship matches, the last international stop on the John Cena retirement tour . the card also featured an Australian Street Fight that involved a cricket bat, a rugby ball and an Aussie rugby ball .

title: Way-Too-Early WNBA Power Rankings: Early look at 2026
content: the Las Vegas Aces are the 2025 champions after a WNBA Finals sweep over the Phoenix Mercury . this offseason will be the busiest in league history . a new collective bargaining agreement is needed, plus expansion drafts for two new franchises .

title: 'Man, he loves football. You can feel it': How Deebo became an instant hit in D.C.
content: quarterback Jayden Daniels and receiver Deebo Samuel performed their skit in the end zone . Daniels connected with Samuel on a fourth-and-goal from the 8-yard line in the win over the los Angeles Chargers . it's one reason why Samuel is off to such a great start in his first season with Washington .
